intro: Spiesia brachybotrys, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, cyathium-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a waxy coating. Spiesia brachybotrys is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
